objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre authored and published this Malware Analysis Report, provided YARA rules, and included disclaimers under UK Crown Copyright.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND C2
objects.description: Hardcoded default C2 IP used by UMBRELLA STAND with fake TLS on port 443.

objects.name: Hidden actor directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling for deployment/persistence and evasion.

objects.name: Shell output file pattern
objects.description: Temporary results file created by UMBRELLA STAND first shell implementation; contents exfiltrated then deleted.

objects.name: Chunk tracking ini file pattern
objects.description: Collection information file used by UMBRELLA STAND second shell implementation to track chunked output; deleted when complete.

objects.name: libguic.so
objects.description: Malicious shared object loaded via ldpreload to bootstrap other components (cisz) for persistence.

objects.name: lidwok BusyBox
objects.description: BusyBox binary renamed to lidwok, used by actors to execute commands within a BusyBox shell.

objects.name: ld.so.preload
objects.description: Used by actors for persistence; presence of /data2/.ztls/libguic.so in this file indicates malicious ldpreload configuration.

objects.name: Reboot hook injection target
objects.description: Hardcoded path of shared object injected into PID 1 (init) by cisz/dskz; likely the reboot_hooker component; file not recovered.

objects.name: Injection path variant
objects.description: Variant hardcoded path observed in strings configuring injection; associated with UMBRELLA STAND tooling.

objects.name: Process spoofing string
objects.description: Hardcoded fake process name used by blghtd to impersonate httpsd in process listings for evasion.

objects.name: Injected tooling log path
objects.description: String present in injected tooling; potential temporary log file created/used by the malware.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: A medium-sophistication malware targeting Fortinet FortiGate 100D series firewalls. It beacons to its C2 using fake TLS (port 443) and AES-encrypted messages, supports configurable beacon frequency and C2 IP, and provides remote shell capability via BusyBox (using ash -c and a 900s timeout). It can read and chunk-exfiltrate files, computes a malware ID from the CRC32 of the hostname, and employs watchdog (jvnlpe) behavior to monitor/restart its networking component (blghtd). It uses process injection (dskz) likely into PID 1 and hooks the device reboot via an injected component (reboot_hooker). Persistence is achieved via reboot hooking and ldpreload loading of libguic.so from /etc/ld.so.preload. Defense evasion includes hidden folders (/data2/.ztls), generic filenames, AES-encrypted stack strings, C2 IP obfuscation, and process name spoofing (/bin/httpsd). The default hardcoded C2 IP in the analyzed sample is 89.44.194.32.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: A previously unknown malware identified on the same device. Its functionality is not directly linked in this report and remains beyond scope; the report speculates it could have been used to deploy additional command-line utilities or to provide a file transfer service.

objects.name: coathanger
objects.description: Referenced malware with considerable similarity to UMBRELLA STAND’s loading components; several tools described in the COATHANGER advisory were also present on the device. Detailed functionality is outside the scope of this report.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Vendor of FortiGate devices targeted by UMBRELLA STAND; the malware hooks Fortinet OS reboot functions and abuses /bin/sysctl to hide its directory.

objects.name: NCSC-NL
objects.description: The Netherlands National Cyber Security Centre (ncsc.nl) is cited via a reference link to a COATHANGER advisory hosted on its site.

objects.name: MIVD
objects.description: The Netherlands Military Intelligence and Security Service, referenced as an author of the COATHANGER advisory linked in the report.

objects.name: AIVD
objects.description: The Netherlands General Intelligence and Security Service, referenced as an author of the COATHANGER advisory linked in the report.

objects.name: MITRE ATT&CK
objects.description: The report maps observed behaviors to the MITRE ATT&CK framework tactics, techniques, and procedures.

objects.name: the-tcpdump-group
objects.description: Referenced as the maintainers of tcpdump in a note pointing to the source repository at github.com/the-tcpdump-group/tcpdump.

objects.name: OpenLDAP Project
objects.description: Referenced as the source of the open-source OpenLDAP implementation; partial overlaps suggest the actors used OpenLDAP.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it’s process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
